title: Renault revenue growth falters on euro strength
text:
April 27, 2018 / 5:17 AM / Updated 26 minutes ago Renault revenue growth falters on euro strength Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
PARIS (Reuters) - French carmaker Renault ( RENA.PA ) said revenue rose by a smaller-than-expected 0.2 percent in the first quarter, held back by currency effects. File photo shows workers who check a car at Renault's assembly plant in Wuhan, Hubei province, China, February 1, 2016. REUTERS/Darley Shen/File photo
Revenue advanced to 13.155 billion euros (11.43 billion pounds) in January-March, Renault said on Friday, missing analyst expectations of 13.77 billion euros, based on the median estimate in an Inquiry Financial poll for Reuters.
The stronger euro cut automotive revenue by 4.8 percent, excluding Russian unit AvtoVAZ. The carmaker reiterated its 2018 market outlook and earnings guidance. Reporting by Laurence Frost
